column4: I am trying to connect to another computer directly via Ethernet, this one is Lucid, the other is WinXP. Can someone help me?
if you are doing Network card to network card. You will need a 'crossover' cable. unless the nic's are gigibit.
I thought most NICs would auto-detect and such anymore.
ive not bought a new NIC in ages.. most all my machines come ith them built in. :) so cant verify or deny that.
but I do belive the auto-detext Is a feature standard in GiB speed nics'

Ah, ok. And yea, the NICs in both computers are built in, Lucid one is a laptop. Not sure the age of either at the moment. Laptop was bought used about 2-3 weeks ago, and I've had the tower for years (five or so seems about right)
You will need to either install a dhcp server on one box. or assign static ip's to each box.
then they will be networked.  If they can ping each other.. they are networkded properly. Then you configure whatever services you want
They are both on the same wireless network already. Does this complicate things, make them easier, or not have any significant effect at all?
wireless is a whole different ballgame.. You never mentioned wireless.
still you would need a DHCP server. or set up static ips or some sort of ad-hoc network. (i think thats the proper term) if they can ping eacjh other. they are working
Yes, I know. Wireless is significantly slower and thus I am wanting to use the ethernet cable.
shouldent be too hard to get going. have windows box make a network. have linux box scan/connect to it
Ah, ok.
Sounds good. Thanks.
i got an odd laptop. if i use the switch to turn off wireless.. i have to go to windows.. turn it back on.. then reboot.. :( i never touch the switch any more
Don't have anything other than Lucid on this machine.
ive seen/heard of so many laptops with flakey switches..  You may want to check the forums for youir exact make/model - ther may be some tweaks for it
wine or its variants/spinoffs or run in a virtual machine.. thats the 2 options

make a new user - see if it works for them? If so you could try resetting all your gnome settings back to defaults.  Ive seen simile rerror messages befor.. but basically cleaned out/reset gnome back to defaults to fix them
if you double click on a folder - does it load in the file manager?
if I click on "home" nautilus opens fine, and browsing folders in nautilus works fine. Just the networking and computer locations that don't work
Hmm.. Never noticed that issue befor.
yeah. Its strange. I think it started out as just the computer location not working. Well, I have Dolphin from Kubuntu installed, and that seems to work fine for network browsing.
